duties_responsibilities.duty: Initiate and establish first direct contact with patients, update patient demographics, and verify insurance to ensure appropriate coverage.
Mentor and train less experienced staff, and assist in overseeing front desk and office activity in the absence of the Supervisor.
Greet and update patient insurance/demographics, ensure physician acceptance of insurance, and verify insurance prior to patient arrival.
Communicate with staff regarding patient arrival, ensure availability of patient medical records for physician, and update HIPAA-related paperwork and institutional forms.
Collect/retrieve referrals or insurance authorizations, review waiting room status, and collect co-pay under billing staff direction.
May schedule patient follow-up appointments, provide guidelines for requesting medical records, and act as liaison between Patient Coordinator Staff and Administrative Assistants.
Participate in customer service initiatives, patient satisfaction survey, ACD, appointment reporting, and ensure compliance with HIPAA and other governmental requirements regarding PHI documents.
Participate and offer input into Performance Appraisal process with the Supervisor, and perform other related duties as required.

education_certification.credential: High School graduate/GED. 3 years secretarial/directly related experience in a medical practice environment.
